segments.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, without giving up these six qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.
Desire for sensual pleasures, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

segments.pli: Kāmesu kho panassa ādīnavo na yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭho hoti.
segments.en: And the drawbacks of sensual pleasures haven’t been truly seen clearly with right wisdom.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme appahāya abhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
segments.en: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.

segments.pli: Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
segments.en: But after giving up these six qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.
Desire for sensual pleasures, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

segments.pli: kāmesu kho panassa ādīnavo na yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭho hoti.
segments.en: And the drawbacks of sensual pleasures have been truly seen clearly with right wisdom.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharitun”ti.
segments.en: After giving up these six qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.”
